properties.areaDesc: Cherokee, OK; Sequoyah, OK; Adair, OK
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 10 at 4:13PM CST until January 10 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
At 412 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 3 miles southeast of Eldon to 4 miles east of
Sallisaw, moving northeast at 60 mph. Wind damage to power poles and
quarter size hail has been reported by emergency management in
Sallisaw.

HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Emergency management.

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable
tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes,
roofs, and outbuildings.

Locations in or near the path include...
Sallisaw...                       Stilwell...
Muldrow...                        Roland...
Westville...                      Marble City...
Brushy...                         Adair State Park...
Christie...                       Maryetta...
Brushy Lake State Park...         Bunch...
Baron...                          Short...

This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 304 and
314, and between mile markers 326 and 328.
properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

NWSheadline: A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH...ADAIR AND SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES
